title: White House To Phase Out Coolant Linked With Climate Change
teaser: The White House will announce measures to phase out R-134a, a popular chemical coolant used in air conditioners and refrigerators.
contentencoded:
The Obama administration will announce plans to phase out R-134a today, a popular chemical coolant that’s been linked with climate change and is used in  both refrigerators and air conditioners.

The new measures would consist of a series of voluntary commitments by chemical firms and retailers to phase out R-134a, according to the Washington Post.

The Wall Street Journal‘s Jason Bellini joins Here & Now‘s Jeremy Hobson to discuss how this will impact businesses that sell the chemical.
